prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: All the transtions selected but specially N2D+ (3-2) can be fitted with a good model if the resolution is 0.1 km/s or below, which is the resolution was set-up in all the lines. Manual window to be able to determine a good continuum. All lines were spectral averaged to be within the expected data rate.

Largest angular scale of cores in similar studies is about 8'' (Tan et al. 2013). Angular resolution was chosen to be able to encompass each core, and to have observations in reasonable amount of time.

We aim to observe N2D+ (3-2) line using ALMA band 6. We selected 9 sources with a declination between -35? to -58?, which we divided in 3 groups, to get each one group in one science goal. We will conduct point observations towards this objects. We do not require ACA to observe point sources. Using one spectral window we will observe N2D+ (3-2) with a sensitivity of 0.1 K in a 0.09 km/s channel, which can be achieved in less than 8 min on source per pointing per source. This sensitivity is enough given the observed values using APEX, and of previous ALMA observations of N2D+ (3-2) (Tan et al. 2013). Observing all targets (split in 3 different science goals) can be achieved in 2h 22m including calibration and overheads. This group can be observed in 55 min including overheads. The remaining three spectral windows will be configured for DCO+ (3-2), SiO (5-4), and 13CS (5-4). They will provide additional information about the deuteration, and about the region.

All the transtions selected but specially N2D+ (3-2) can be fitted with a good model if the resolution is 0.1 km/s or below, which is the resolution was set-up in all the lines. Manual window to be able to determine a good continuum. All lines were spectral averaged to be within the expected data rate.

Largest angular scale of cores in similar studies is about 8'' (Tan et al. 2013). Angular resolution was chosen to be able to encompass each core, and to have observations in reasonable amount of time.

Observing all targets (split in 3 different science goals) can be achieved in 2h 22m including calibration and overheads. This group can be observed in 50 min including overheads. The remaining three spectral windows will be configured for DCO+ (3-2), SiO (5-4), and 13CS (5-4). They will provide additional information about the deuteration, and about the region.

Manual window to be able to determine a good continuum. All lines were spectral averaged to be within the expected data rate.

Largest angular scale of cores in similar studies is about 8'' (Tan et al. 2013). Angular resolution was chosen to be able to encompass each core, and to have observations in reasonable amount of time.

We aim to observe N2D+ (3-2) line using ALMA band 6. We selected 9 sources with a declination between -35? to -58?, which we divided in 3 groups, to get each one group in one science goal. We will conduct point observations towards this objects. We do not require ACA to observe point sources. The remaining three spectral windows will be configured for DCO+ (3-2), SiO (5-4), and 13CS (5-4). They will provide additional information about the deuteration, and about the region.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: High mass stars play a dominant role in the shaping and evolution of galaxies. However, the formation process and early evolution of high-mass stars is not well understood. Deuterium containing molecular species provide a highly selective probe of the quiescent and cold material in a molecular cloud. N2D+ (3-2) is a well known tracer of dense gas in star forming regions without being affected by depletion as are C-bearing species. The deuteration ratio derived from N2D+ is often used as an evolutionary tracer in star formation. But our recent results show that there is a lack of correlation between the presence of a protostar and the presence of N2D+. Mostly due to the lack of angular resolution prior to ALMA. We plan to observe N2D+ (3-2) towards 6 high mass regions with high deuteration ratio, likely sites for massive star and cluster formation, in order to study the quiescent evolutionary stage of high mass star formation and its association with the 70 micron emission.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Jodrell Bank Centre for Astrophysics, Manchester, University of
